EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network at positions (0.0, 0.0), (5.0, 0.0), (2.5, 0.5) & (2.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at position (0.0, 0.0):
 – Stone Furnace (position 0.0, 0.0) now holding fuel Inventory({'coal': 8}) and operating in WORKING status.
 – Burner Inserter (position 1.5, 0.5).
• Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at position (5.0, 0.0):
 – Stone Furnace (position 5.0, 0.0) with fuel Inventory({'coal': 4}) and status NO_INGREDIENTS.
 – Burner Inserter (position 3.5, 0.5).
• Common Input Chest:
 – Wooden Chest (position 2.5, 0.5) stocking copper-plate.
• New Feeder Inserter:
 – Feeder Inserter (position 2.5, -0.5) with pickup at (2.5, -1.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5).
• Transport Belt Connection:
 – BeltGroup linking from mining output at (–14.5, –47.5) to feeder inserter pickup at (2.5, –1.5) using 64 belts.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup at position (–15.0, –50.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill (position –15.0, –50.0) with drop position (–14.5, –48.5):
 – Updated fuel: Inventory({'coal': 9}).
 – Warning: “output blocked by item on the ground. There is no sink entity in place to accept the output.”
 – Status: WAITING_FOR_SPACE_IN_DESTINATION.
• Drill Inserter (position –13.5, –47.5):
 – Pickup at (–12.5, –47.5) and drop at (–14.5, –47.5).

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Incorrect Entity Removal Invocation:
 – When removing feeder inserters, supply None for the second argument if the first is an Entity to avoid parameter mismatches.

• Resource and Inventory Management:
 – Ensure sufficient fuel is available before attempting to supply entities.
 – Verify that the required count of transport belts (e.g. 64 units) is in inventory before connecting systems.

• Transport Belt Connection and Sink Placement Errors:
 – Check that target placement areas are unobstructed and buildable; “Cannot place transport belt” errors indicate invalid or occupied tiles.
 – Define all necessary variables (e.g. ensure ‘belt_sink’ is declared) to prevent undefined name errors.
 – Use correct property access (e.g. use buildable_area.center without invoking it as a function) to avoid TypeError.
 – Confirm that the player is positioned within the allowed range (max 10 units) of the target to prevent “target position is too far” errors.
 – Verify the inventory contains transport belt items to preclude placement failures due to shortages.

• API and Parameter Handling:
 – Always validate tile occupancy and parameter types when calling API functions to prevent misplacements and type-related errors.

NAMESPACE
─────────
shift_entity_local(entity: Entity, offset: Tuple[float, float]) -> Entity
 • Shifts the given entity’s position locally by the specified offset.
  – Invocation succeeded and resolved previous shift_entity issues.

Important Variables:
• furnace_input_chest_pos (Position) – holds the position of the furnace’s input chest.
• current_player_inventory (Inventory) – tracks the current state of the player’s inventory.
